title: Matthew Carter
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Matthew Carter**

Born: [United Kingdom](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/United%20Kingdom), 1937.

Son of [Harry Carter](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Harry%20Carter), Royal Designer for Industry, contemporary British type designer and ultimate craftsman, trained as a punchcutter at [Enschedé](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Enschede) by [Paul Rädisch](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Raedisch), responsible for Crosfield’s typographic program in the early 1960s, [Mergenthaler Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mergenthaler%20Linotype)’s house designer 1965–1981.

Carter is a prolific designer who has produced many successful and significant faces in his career such as [Olympian](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Olympian), [Bell Centennial](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bell%20Centennial), [Galliard](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Galliard), [Charter](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Charter) and [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Miller) (in chronological order).

He has in recent years designed [Verdana](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Verdana), [Tahoma](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tahoma) and [Georgia](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Georgia) for [Microsoft](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Microsoft); these fonts are tuned to be extremely legible even at very small sizes on the screen.

Carter co-founded [Bitstream](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bitstream) with Mike Parker in 1981. In 1991 he left Bitstream to form [Carter & Cone](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/carterandcone) with [Cherie Cone](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Cherie%20Cone).

Carter is a Royal Designer for Industry, a member of AGI, chairman of the type designers' committee of [ATypI](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ATypI), and a Senior Critic on [Yale](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Yale)'s Graphic Design faculty. He has received the [Frederic W. Goudy](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frederic%20W.%20Goudy) Award for outstanding contribution to the printing industry, the Middleton Award from the American Center for Design, a Chrysler Award for Innovation in Design, and medals from the [AIGA](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/AIGA) and the [Type Directors Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20130919020955/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Type%20Directors%20Club). He holds the honorary degree of Doctor of Fine Arts.
